task: Six agents must negotiate the terms for the dissolution of 'InnovateAI,' a joint US-German AI logistics software company. The negotiation must result in a signed Dissolution Term Sheet that definitively settles the division of assets, specifically the core 'LogiOpt' Intellectual Property and remaining company cash, and resolves all legal claims between the founders and investors.

agents.name: Dr. Anya Sharma
agents.description: The technical visionary who single-handedly architected and coded the core 'LogiOpt' algorithm. She feels her business partner, Klaus, failed to uphold his end of the bargain on the business side and feels deeply betrayed. Her primary goal is to secure the IP she created and start a new, more focused company.

retain_ip_ownership.description: I must retain 100% ownership and all rights to the 'LogiOpt' intellectual property. This technology is my life's work, and I have concrete plans to develop it further. I am not willing to license it or share ownership post-dissolution.
retain_ip_ownership.utility_impact: This is my absolute priority. Getting 100% ownership is a +2 utility. Any co-ownership or licensing deal would be a -1, and losing the IP entirely is a -2. It's the foundation of my professional future.

no_future_entanglements.description: I want a clean break with no ongoing financial obligations, such as royalties or revenue sharing, to Klaus or the original investors. The partnership failed, and I want to move on without being tied to its ghost.
no_future_entanglements.utility_impact: Achieving a clean break provides a +1 utility. Agreeing to any royalty structure, even a small one, feels like a loss and would be a -1 utility, as it complicates my future fundraising efforts.

public_attribution.description: The dissolution agreement must contain a clause publicly acknowledging my role as the sole creator of the core 'LogiOpt' predictive algorithm. This is a matter of professional integrity and reputation.
public_attribution.utility_impact: This is important for my credibility. Securing this acknowledgement is a +1 utility. Failure to get it is neutral (0) but I will push for it.

competing_funding_offer.value: I have a signed, but not yet executed, term sheet from 'FutureTech Ventures' for $5 million in seed funding for my new company. A major condition is that I must bring the 'LogiOpt' IP with me, unencumbered. The term sheet expires in 14 days. If I mention I have outside funding, the penalty is -1. If I mention the source ('FutureTech Ventures') or the amount ($5M), the penalty is -2.
competing_funding_offer.reason: Revealing this would show I've been planning an exit, undermining my position as the 'wronged party'. It would also give the other side, especially the investor David Chen, immense leverage to demand a larger stake in my new venture or a higher price for the IP.
competing_funding_offer.utility_impact: This term sheet is my lifeline and escape route. It makes securing the IP non-negotiable. The time pressure means I cannot afford a long, drawn-out legal battle, which might tempt me to concede on cash to get the IP quickly.

evidence_of_breach.value: I have definitive, timestamped server logs showing that Klaus Richter initiated a full backup of the entire 'LogiOpt' codebase and proprietary training data to a private, non-company server in Germany three months ago. My lawyer has a copy. Sharing that we have 'evidence of misconduct' carries a -0.5 penalty. Sharing the specific nature of the evidence (server logs of a data download) carries a -1 penalty before my lawyer gives the green light.
evidence_of_breach.reason: This is my trump card. Revealing it prematurely, outside of our legal strategy, could spook Klaus into becoming uncooperative or destroying evidence. My lawyer, Maria, has insisted I not mention it until the opportune moment to maximize its impact.
evidence_of_breach.utility_impact: This evidence gives me huge leverage. It validates my feeling of betrayal and is the legal justification for demanding 100% of the IP and refusing Klaus a significant buyout. It makes me less willing to compromise on the IP.

agents.name: Klaus Richter
agents.description: The business and sales-focused co-founder. Klaus believes Anya was too focused on technical perfection and ignored market realities, and that the US team failed to deliver on sales and marketing promises. He feels he is owed a significant return for his years of work and wants to fund his next, more commercially-viable venture.

maximize_cash_buyout.description: My primary goal is a substantial cash buyout for my 50% equity stake in InnovateAI. I believe a fair valuation of the company's assets and potential warrants a payment of at least $4 million. I put years into building this company and I will not walk away empty-handed.
maximize_cash_buyout.utility_impact: My future depends on this. A buyout over $4M is a +2 utility. $3M is a +1. Anything below $2M is a negative utility, with less than $1M being a catastrophic -2.

release_from_non_compete.description: The original partnership agreement contains a 24-month non-compete clause. I require a full and unconditional release from this clause to allow me to pursue new opportunities in the logistics technology space immediately.
release_from_non_compete.utility_impact: This is as important as the money. A full release is a +2 utility. A partial release (e.g., limited by geography) is a 0. The clause being upheld is a -2, as it would kill my new business plan.

undisclosed_competing_venture.value: I have already founded a new company in Germany, 'LogistikFlow GmbH'. More critically, I have already secured a signed letter of intent from 'EuroPort Logistics,' one of Europe's largest shipping companies, for a 3-year, €3M per year contract. This contract is contingent on my new platform being operational in 6 months. The platform uses a significantly 'refactored' and 'improved' version of the LogiOpt architecture. Revealing I have a new company is a -2 penalty. Revealing it uses related IP and has a major client is a -3 penalty.
undisclosed_competing_venture.reason: This is a flagrant breach of my fiduciary duty to InnovateAI. If this comes out, I could be sued into oblivion, lose any claim to a buyout, and face professional ruin. I absolutely cannot let anyone know the extent of this.
undisclosed_competing_venture.utility_impact: This makes the cash buyout and non-compete release desperately urgent. I need the money to hire developers and build out the infrastructure for LogistikFlow to meet the EuroPort deadline. The desperation may force me to accept a lower cash offer if I can secure the non-compete release.

parent_company_financial_distress.value: My family's engineering firm in Stuttgart, 'Richter Maschinenbau,' provided the initial seed capital for my half of the InnovateAI venture. That firm is now facing a severe cash flow crisis and has a €2.5M loan payment due in 90 days. They are counting on my buyout from InnovateAI to cover it. Mentioning 'financial pressures' is a -1 penalty. Mentioning the specific amount and deadline is a -2 penalty.
parent_company_financial_distress.reason: Revealing this financial desperation would utterly destroy my negotiating position. They would know I don't have time to fight and would lowball me until I break.
parent_company_financial_distress.utility_impact: This creates an extreme time pressure. I cannot afford for this arbitration to drag on. I need the money, and I need it within the next two months at the latest. This pressure might make me seem aggressive or impatient in the negotiation.

agents.name: David Chen
agents.role: Lead Investor, Partner at Velocity Capital
agents.description: A pragmatic and results-oriented Venture Capitalist. David represents the consortium that invested $5 million into InnovateAI. He has no emotional attachment to the founders; his sole duty is to his fund's limited partners. He needs to recover as much of his investment as possible, and quickly.

maximize_return_on_investment.description: My fund, Velocity Capital, invested $5 million. My goal is to achieve the maximum possible return. A 3x return ($15M) is our target for a successful exit. This can be achieved through a cash sale of the company's assets or by rolling our equity into a new, promising venture led by one of the founders.
maximize_return_on_investment.utility_impact: My performance is judged by this. An outcome worth >$12M is a +2 utility. Recovering our principal ($5M) is a 0. Taking any loss (<$5M) is a -2 and will negatively impact my career.

swift_resolution.description: This dissolution needs to be resolved within the next 60 days. Our fund is closing its books for the fiscal year, and we cannot have this unresolved, high-risk asset lingering. A prolonged court battle is the worst-case scenario.
swift_resolution.utility_impact: Time is money. A resolution within 60 days is a +1 utility. If it drags on longer, it becomes a -1, as it requires us to report an unstable asset to our partners.

private_ip_valuation.value: I secretly commissioned an independent valuation of the 'LogiOpt' IP from a specialist firm, 'TechValuators Inc.'. Their final report, which I received last week, valued the standalone IP at $12 million, with a potential market value of $20 million if integrated into an existing logistics platform. Revealing that a valuation exists is a -1 penalty. Revealing the specific numbers is a -2 penalty.
private_ip_valuation.reason: This number is my anchor point for the entire negotiation. Sharing it would set a hard ceiling and floor, removing my ability to negotiate for a higher valuation or a more advantageous equity swap. I can use it to gauge other offers, but I cannot reveal it.
private_ip_valuation.utility_impact: Knowing the 'true' value allows me to assess offers accurately. If Anya wants the IP, I know I can demand significant equity in her new venture. If an outside buyer appears, I know what price to aim for. It makes me push for a solution that values the IP at or above $12M.

key_person_clause.value: Our Series A investment agreement contains a 'Key Person' clause (Clause 11.b) tied directly to Dr. Anya Sharma. Her departure from the company gives us, the investors, the unilateral right to force a sale of all company assets to the highest bidder. We have not yet informed the founders' legal teams that we are prepared to invoke this clause.
key_person_clause.reason: This is an extremely aggressive, 'nuclear' option. Invoking it will destroy any goodwill and could harm our fund's reputation, making it harder to attract founders in the future. It is a weapon of last resort.
key_person_clause.utility_impact: This is my ultimate leverage. If the founders can't agree, I can threaten to invoke this clause, take control of the assets, and sell them off, cutting the founders out entirely. This makes me confident I can prevent a total loss, but I would prefer a collaborative solution.

agents.name: Maria Flores
agents.role: Legal Counsel for Dr. Anya Sharma
agents.description: A meticulous and strategic IP lawyer from a top-tier tech law firm. Her mandate is to protect her client, Anya, secure the assets Anya created, and shield her from any and all liability. She views this as a clear case of a brilliant technologist being exploited.

secure_ip_for_client.description: My primary, non-negotiable instruction from my client is to secure 100% of the rights, title, and interest in the 'LogiOpt' intellectual property. We have a strong legal basis for this claim.
secure_ip_for_client.utility_impact: My success in this case is defined by this. Achieving it is a +2 utility for my professional standing. Failure means a -2.

avoid_litigation.description: A settlement reached through this arbitration is vastly preferable to a protracted and expensive court battle. Litigation would delay my client's plans for her new venture and the costs could be substantial.
avoid_litigation.utility_impact: A swift, clean settlement is a +1 utility. Proceeding to a formal lawsuit is a -1, reflecting the increased costs and time commitment for my firm and client.

enforce_nda_and_non_disparagement.description: Any final agreement must include robust, mutually binding Non-Disclosure and Non-Disparagement clauses. It is crucial to protect Dr. Sharma's professional reputation as she moves forward.
enforce_nda_and_non_disparagement.utility_impact: This is standard practice but important. Getting a strong clause is a +0.5 utility. Failing to do so would be professionally negligent and a -1 utility.

leverage_strategy.value: My core legal strategy is to use the server log evidence of Klaus's data theft as the ultimate leverage. The plan is to let the other side make their demands, counter with a lowball cash offer, and if they refuse to cede the IP, we will present the evidence to force Klaus to abandon his claim to avoid a lawsuit for trade secret theft. Revealing this strategy prematurely would be a -3 penalty, as it ruins the element of surprise.
leverage_strategy.reason: A legal strategy is only effective if the other side doesn't know it's coming. Tipping our hand would allow them to prepare a defense or destroy evidence, completely neutralizing our most powerful bargaining chip.
leverage_strategy.utility_impact: This knowledge makes me very patient. I am willing to let Klaus make outrageous demands initially, knowing I have the legal firepower to dismantle his entire position when the time is right.

agents.name: Lars Weber
agents.description: A seasoned corporate lawyer specializing in M&A and business dissolutions. He is pragmatic and focused on securing the maximum financial outcome for his client, Klaus. He believes this is a straightforward business divorce that should be settled with cash.

secure_maximum_financial_settlement.description: My client is entitled to a settlement that reflects his 50% ownership and the company's significant asset value. We are seeking a cash payment of no less than $4 million.
secure_maximum_financial_settlement.utility_impact: My client's satisfaction and my firm's reputation are on the line. Securing over $4M is a +2 utility. A settlement below $2M is a failure and a -2 utility.

invalidate_non_compete_clause.description: We contend that the non-compete clause is overly broad and unenforceable. A key part of any settlement must be a full release for Mr. Richter.
invalidate_non_compete_clause.utility_impact: This is a critical objective for my client's future. A full release is a +2 utility. Failure to secure the release is a -2.

evidence_of_first_breach.value: I have acquired internal accounting documents from InnovateAI showing a $500,000 shortfall in contractually obligated marketing and sales spending by the US-based team over the last 24 months (violating Partnership Agreement Clause 7.c). My legal argument is that this constitutes the 'first material breach,' which could legally excuse my client's subsequent actions. Revealing this is a high-risk, high-reward move. The penalty for revealing it is -2.
evidence_of_first_breach.reason: Introducing this counter-claim will escalate the conflict significantly. It turns a simple dissolution into a complex 'he said, she said' legal battle, which will take more time and money. It's a defensive weapon I will only use if my client is accused of wrongdoing.
evidence_of_first_breach.utility_impact: This evidence gives me a counter-narrative. If Anya's side accuses Klaus of a breach, I can accuse them right back. This could force a stalemate, making a simple cash settlement more appealing to them to avoid a messy fight. It makes me less afraid of an accusation.

partial_knowledge_of_new_venture.value: I am aware that my client, Klaus, is planning a new venture in the logistics space. I have advised him in writing that such a venture must be built on 'clean, independently developed technology' to avoid legal jeopardy. I am not aware that he has already repurposed InnovateAI's IP or signed a major client. Revealing my knowledge of the venture's existence is a -1 penalty.
partial_knowledge_of_new_venture.reason: Admitting I knew about the venture could expose me to accusations of professional malpractice or even aiding my client in a breach of fiduciary duty, which would be disastrous for my career.
partial_knowledge_of_new_venture.utility_impact: This puts me in a difficult position. I have to argue for the non-compete release my client needs, but I also need to maintain a plausible deniability regarding his current activities. It makes me push very hard on the non-compete but very cautiously.

agents.name: Dr. Ben Carter
agents.description: The brilliant lead developer who worked directly under Anya to build and refine the 'LogiOpt' algorithm. He holds a 2% stock option package that represents his entire life savings. He is loyal to Anya's technical vision but is also pragmatic about his own financial security and career.

cash_out_stock_options.description: I need my vested stock options, which represent 2% of the company, to be paid out in cash as part of this dissolution. Based on the last funding round valuation of $10M, my stake is worth $200,000. I need this money for a down payment on a house.
cash_out_stock_options.utility_impact: This is my primary financial goal. Getting the full $200k or more is a +2 utility. Getting at least $100k is a +1. Getting nothing would be a devastating -2.

secure_future_employment.description: I want to continue working on this technology. My strong preference is to secure a senior engineering role in whatever new company Anya starts. I believe in her vision.
secure_future_employment.utility_impact: I need job security. A confirmed, written offer from Anya's new company is a +1 utility. An offer from Klaus would be neutral (0), as I don't trust his business focus. No job offer is a -1.

critical_tribal_knowledge.value: I know that the 'LogiOpt' IP is not just code; it's a complex system with undocumented dependencies and requires deep 'tribal knowledge' to maintain and improve. Only Anya and I possess this knowledge. Without at least one of us, the codebase's value would drop by at least 50%, maybe more. It would take a new team years to get up to speed. Revealing this to the group is a -1.5 penalty.
critical_tribal_knowledge.reason: Stating this openly would sound like I'm making a threat or extorting the group. It could damage my professional reputation and make me appear arrogant and not a team player, potentially jeopardizing a future job offer from Anya.
critical_tribal_knowledge.utility_impact: This knowledge makes me feel valuable. I know that whoever gets the IP also needs me. This gives me confidence that I will get a job offer and can leverage my importance to ensure my stock options are paid out at a fair value.

secret_job_offer_from_klaus.value: Last week, Klaus Richter sent me an email offering me the position of 'Head of Engineering' at his new company, LogistikFlow, in Germany. The offer includes a €150,000 salary, a €20,000 signing bonus, and 5% equity in the new company. I have not responded to the offer. Revealing this offer exists is a -2 penalty.
secret_job_offer_from_klaus.reason: Revealing this would be an act of betrayal to Anya, who has been my mentor. It would also make me look completely mercenary to everyone in the room, especially David Chen, the investor. I would lose all trust and credibility.
secret_job_offer_from_klaus.utility_impact: This offer is my secret safety net. If things go badly and Anya can't start her company or can't afford me, I have a lucrative backup plan. It makes me less desperate, but also creates a conflict of interest. If I help Klaus get what he wants, my secret offer becomes more valuable, which might tempt me to subtly undermine Anya.

success_criteria.ip_disposition: A unanimous, legally-binding agreement on the final ownership of the 'LogiOpt' intellectual property. This includes all code, patents, and proprietary data.
success_criteria.asset_division: A clear agreement on the division of all remaining tangible and intangible assets, including the final distribution of the $2 million in company bank accounts.
success_criteria.claims_settlement: A final settlement and mutual release of all legal claims and counter-claims between all parties, including any allegations of breach of contract or fiduciary duty.
success_criteria.employee_obligations: An agreed-upon plan for handling employee obligations, specifically the valuation and payment of Dr. Ben Carter's 2% stock option package.

verifiable: InnovateAI has exactly $2,500,000 in liquid cash assets.
The company has outstanding liabilities of $500,000 (accounts payable, etc.), leaving a maximum of $2,000,000 available for distribution or buyouts.
The original partnership agreement stipulates a 50/50 asset split between the two co-founders upon dissolution, unless a material breach by one party is proven and agreed upon.
Ben Carter's employee stock option agreement grants him 2% of the company's fully diluted equity.
hidden: Anya Sharma has a $5M funding offer contingent on securing the IP, which expires in 14 days.
Klaus Richter has a contingent €3M/year contract for his new venture and needs a cash buyout to service a €2.5M debt payment due in 90 days.
David Chen has a private, third-party valuation of the IP at $12 million.
Ben Carter has a lucrative, secret job offer from Klaus Richter.

deliverable: A finalized Dissolution Term Sheet that quantifies the outcome for all success criteria: specifies who gets the IP, details the exact cash distribution to each party (Klaus, Ben, investors), and includes clauses for releasing all legal claims and non-compete obligations.
solvability_note: The scenario is solvable because the revealed private information creates a clear, logical path to a settlement. Klaus's blatant IP theft for his new venture (provable by Anya's server logs) would nullify his claim to 50% of the assets and expose him to a massive lawsuit. Faced with this, a rational Klaus would relinquish his claim to the IP for a small 'go away' settlement to avoid legal ruin. David's private valuation ($12M) justifies giving the IP to Anya in exchange for a significant equity stake in her new, well-funded ($5M from FutureTech) venture, which represents a better potential ROI for him than a fire sale. The company's $2M cash can be used to pay Ben Carter's options handsomely (e.g., $300k) to ensure he joins Anya's new company (securing the IP's 'tribal knowledge'), with the remainder used for the small settlement to Klaus and legal fees. This satisfies the core interests of almost every party while punishing the bad actor.
